item.title: CVE-2021-1675 | The Precursor to PrintNightmare
item.description: CVE-2021-1675 is a elevation of privilege vulnerability that affected all Windows Servers from version 2004 to 20H2 and all windows desktops from Windows 7 to Windows 10. While CVE-2021-1675 and CVE-2021-34527 (PrintNightmare) take advantage of the windows print spooler, both exploits approach the vulnerability in different ways. CVE-2021-1675 can only be exploited locally and is only used to escalate user privileges while PrintNightmare is uses Remote Code Execution which makes the threat of the vulnerability much higher.
